Html:
I have managed to parse and run a text using SearchGrammar.
the following string 
   Black Cat "White Horse" -dog
was parsed into 
  ((( FORMSOF (INFLECTIONAL, Black)  AND  FORMSOF (INFLECTIONAL, Cat) ) AND "White     Horse") AND NOT  FORMSOF (INFLECTIONAL, dog) )
Can I use the result with the freetext predicate?
Since the freetext predicate generates Link inflections, is there still a need?
(If it is only for usage with contains predicate I will loose other freetext featuers like the expansions or replacements)

Well, you got it parsed, converted, and it's now a question of proper use of the resulting query in SQL Server - so try it, and dig into MSDN if it does not work. I'm not an expert on FTS.
Roman
